description: people relaxing outdoors; mother, father and child with ball in LRQ; reclining woman with child wearing straw hat, LLC; herd of cows at left middle ground; trees and buildings, URC; printed in graduated tones of green and rust red
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, Edition and Stamp

ULC, in pencil: [LB 241 II]; LRC on back, in pencil: [22295 / 1501]
markings: LRC on back, stamped in black: two collectors\' stamps
provenance:
Leona Prasse, Cleveland (1896–1984). [Catherine E. Burns, Oakland, CA, until 1998; sold in March for RNOO, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1998-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA).

Leona Prasse was curator of prints at the Cleveland Art Museum.
signed: LLC, in block: [A. Lepère]; LLC and LRC on back, in graphite: [Bucolique moderne]; LRC, in pencil: [2e. Etat (essai / A L] and [Essai en deux tons du trait seul]
title: Modern Pastoral Pleasures
